title: These headphones ensure you’re never without audio and keep your ears open for only $30
content:
Macworld

If you’re in the market for a new set of headphones and don’t like the feeling of over- or in-ear headphones, it’s time to try bone conduction headphones. These open-ear headphones use bone conduction technology to send vibrations to your inner ears, delivering crystal-clear sound without obstructing your ears. Through February 25, you can get them for only $29.97 (reg. $79).

These feather-light headphones are made from soft plastic and fit comfortably on top of your ears, allowing you to listen to your music while still being aware of the sounds around you. Whether you’re running in the city and need to be safe crossing the roads or simply want to be aware of your coworkers in the office, you can have your musical cake and eat it, too.

The headphones work via Bluetooth and offer Siri and voice command compatibility with certain apps. They’re even IPX6 water-resistant, making them suitable to wear in the rain and during grueling workouts. And with their 6-hour capacity after a full charge, these headphones can sustain your audio needs during days at the office, afternoon walks, and more.

You have until February 25 at 11:59 p.m. Pacific to grab these Open-Ear Conduction Stereo Wireless Headphones for just $29.97. No coupon needed.
